snippet: A Southern legal advocacy group has claimed in a lawsuit that the State of South Carolina should not have surgically altered a 16-month-old child in its custody.
abstract: Southern legal advocacy group claims in lawsuit that State of South Carolina should not have surgically altered a 16-month-old child in its custody who was born with both male and female genitalia; suit is filed on behalf of child's adoptive parents and is intended to restrict practice of medically unnecessary sex assignment surgeries on infants.
lead_paragraph: A Southern legal advocacy group has claimed in a lawsuit that the State of South Carolina should not have surgically altered a 16-month-old child in its custody.

headline.main: South Carolina: Sex Surgery Unnecessary, Lawsuit Alleges
